text: Rochester, Nunda and Pennsylvania Railroad was a New York railroad. Trains ran from Sonyea south through Nunda to Swain. Parts of the railroad were sold to the Pittsburg, Shawmut and Northern Railroad. Other parts of the RN&P; were graded near York, NY and Fowlerville, NY and also near Chili, New York, but no tracks were ever laid. ==References== ==Photos== Paige Miller's Flickr Set, showing photos of the graded but unfinished portions of the RN&P; Category:Defunct New York (state) railroads
title: Rochester, Nunda and Pennsylvania Railroad
